column4: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gvfs/+bug/227808 how can i replace gvfs with sshfs? will simply installing sshfs and uninstalling gvfs break anything? will nautilus use sshfs?
gvfs is the Gnome Virtual Filesystem, used only in the GNOME desktop. If you don't use GNOME, you can safely remove it
